snippet.title: Dirt bike rider dies
snippet.content:
Dirt bike rider dies
Emergency services are at Wallsend after a dirt bike rider died on Sunday. Picture: Max Mason-Hubers
Emergency services are at Wallsend after a dirt bike rider died on Sunday. Picture: Max Mason-Hubers
Emergency services are at Wallsend after a dirt bike rider died on Sunday. Picture: Max Mason-Hubers
Emergency services are at Wallsend after a dirt bike rider died on Sunday. Picture: Max Mason-Hubers
Emergency services are at Wallsend after a dirt bike rider died on Sunday. Picture: Max Mason-Hubers
Emergency services are at Wallsend after a dirt bike rider died on Sunday. Picture: Max Mason-Hubers
Emergency services are at Wallsend after a dirt bike rider died on Sunday. Picture: Max Mason-Hubers
Emergency services are at Wallsend after a dirt bike rider died on Sunday. Picture: Max Mason-Hubers
exit
A DIRT bike rider has died after suffering a heart attack in bushland at Wallsend on Sunday. A spokesman for the Hunter's Westpac Rescue Helicopter Service said they were called to a section of bush off the Newcastle Link Road about 12.40pm. A doctor and paramedic were winched down into the crash site and the helicopter has landed on a nearby roundabout. Meanwhile, police are investigating after a fatal crash at Howes Valley, about 60 kilometres south-west of Singleton, on Sunday.
Police and emergency services were called to Putty Road about 1.50pm, following reports of a crash. Initial inquiries suggest two vehicles have crashed head on, police said. A man was trapped and died at the scene. A woman was treated by NSW Ambulance paramedics and taken to John Hunter Hospital. Hunter Valley police are investigating and will prepare a report for the coroner.
